meanings.definition: To make a hissing or bubbling sound
meanings.sent1: The soda can was fizzing loudly when I opened it.
meanings.sent2: I love the sound of water fizzing in a glass on a hot day.
meanings.sent3: The potion in the wizard's cauldron was fizzing like a mischievous sprite.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the room was fizzing like a pot about to boil over.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks fizzing in the night sky painted a beautiful picture.

meanings.sent1: The children were fizzing with joy at the sight of the presents.
meanings.sent2: She was fizzing with anticipation before the big race.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was fizzing with energy, running around the yard in circles.
meanings.sent4: The crowd was fizzing with excitement as the band took the stage.
meanings.sent5: His mind was fizzing with ideas for the new project.

meanings.sent1: The fizzing of the soda was music to my ears.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious potion emitted a strange fizzing in the dark room.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected fizzing from the kitchen made everyone curious about what was cooking.
meanings.sent4: The fizzing of the stream added to the peaceful atmosphere of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The fizzing of the fireworks signaled the start of the celebration.

meanings.sent1: The fizzing puppy couldn't sit still for a second.
meanings.sent2: Her fizzing enthusiasm was contagious, spreading to everyone around her.
meanings.sent3: The fizzing atmosphere at the party made it clear that it was going to be a fun night.
meanings.sent4: The fizzing energy of the crowd fueled the team to victory.
meanings.sent5: The fizzing anticipation in the air made the event even more thrilling.
